      • drawCurve

        public void drawCurve(double pow,
                      char inner)

        Draw curve at cursor coordinates

        Parameters:
        pow - Power to which the curve is rasied. For example 2 mean y=x^2 and 3 means y=x^3.
        inner - Character to fill the curve.

      • drawPhase

        public void drawPhase(double r,
                      char inner)

        Draw partially-obscured circle. A normal line at the bisector of the line drawn between the origin and the cursor acts as a veil to obscure a portion of the circle.

        Parameters:
        r - Radius of circle
        inner - character to fill the shape.

        Parameters:
        inner - Character to fill shape.

      • drawOval

        public void drawOval(double roundness,
                     char inner)

        Draw oval between the origin and the cursor coordinates

        Parameters:
        roundness - Multiplier used in deciding the shape of the oval
        inner - Character to fill the shape

      • drawBox

        public void drawBox(char edge0,
                    char edge1)

        Draw box within the range of the max and min y values and within the range of the max and min x values of the origin and cursor

        Parameters:
        edge0 - Character to draw box edge with by default
        edge1 - Alternative character to draw box edge with in the case where character being overwritten is equal edge0

      • boundarySearch

        public java.util.List<int[]> boundarySearch(int mode,
                                            int range,
                                            boolean includeCorners)

        Generate a list of coordinates found under certain conditions using a boundary fill style algorithm

        Parameters:
        mode - Accepts values 0 or 1 to determine whether to search for like characters or to search for an item respectively.
        range - The distance that is checked up, down, left and right of a coordinate that is to be checked
        includeCorners - Boolean value determining whether to include the 'corners' of the search area at the end of the list.
        Returns:
        List of int[] arrays representing coordinates in the buffer that have been deemed suitable in the search

      • boundaryFill

        public void boundaryFill(char replace)

        Boundary fill an area of the buffer

        Parameters:
        replace - Character to substitute into the boundary fill coordinates

      • boundaryFillShaded

        public void boundaryFillShaded(char A,
                               char B,
                               char C)

        Shaded boundary fill an area of the buffer

        Parameters:
        A - Character representing illuminated-surface
        B - Character representing shaded-surface
        C - Character representing dark-surface

      • copyItem

        public void copyItem(int range)

        Copy an item from the buffer

        Where an item is a group of coorindates surrounded by space characters.

        Parameters:
        range - Value passed to boundarySearch. See boundarySearch.

      • eraseItem

        public void eraseItem(int range)

        Erase an item from the buffer

        Where an item is a group of coorindates surrounded by space characters.

        Parameters:
        range - Value passed to boundarySearch. See boundarySearch.

      • copy

        public void copy()

        Copy region from buffer within the range of the max and min y values and within the range of the max and min x values of the cursor and origin

      • paste

        public void paste(int mode)

        Paste clipBoard at cursor coordinates

        Parameters:
        mode - Value 0 or 1 determines whether to paste with 'blankspace' as in space characters, where 0 is with spaces and 1 is without

      • tile

        public void tile(int mode)

        Tile the clipBoard across the buffer

        Parameters:
        mode - Value 0 or 1 determines whether to tile with 'blankspace' as in space characters, where 0 is with spaces and 1 is without

      • rotate

        public void rotate(int mode)

        Rotate the contents of the buffer by 90 degrees clockwise or anti-clockwise

        Parameters:
        mode - Determines whether to rotate clockwise/anti-clockwise as 0/1 respectively.

      • mirror

        public void mirror(int mode)

        Mirror the contents of the buffer horizontally or vertically

        Parameters:
        mode - Determines whether to mirror horizontally/vertically as 0/1 respectively.

      • mandelbrot

        public void mandelbrot(double xPos,
                       double yPos,
                       double scale)

        Draw mandelbrot onto buffer

        Parameters:
        xPos - Determines ofset of view from x=0
        yPos - Determines ofset of view from y=0
        scale - Determines the zoom factor of the Mandelbrot
